data.title: Roald Dahl Museum – The Oxford Magazine
data.meta_description: The Roald Dahl Museum in Great Missenden, Buckinghamshire is packed with activities perfect for 6 to 12 year olds and their families.
data.text:
About the Roald Dahl Museum

Visit the Roald Dahl Museum, a great little family attraction in the heart of Roald Dahl country.

Get hands-on in the three galleries, packed with activities perfect for 6 to 12 year olds and their families. Find out about Roald Dahl’s school pranks, peek into the author’s original Writing Hut, and discover how Roald Dahl’s real-life adventures inspired his stories. The Museum puts your imagination centre-stage to help you and your family create your own swashboggling stories – just like Roald Dahl did.

The Roald Dahl Museum and Story Centre has three fun and fact-packed galleries. Throughout the Museum you will find a mix of objects and archive material to look at, things to watch and to listen to, as well as interactive activities to help you learn more about the stories behind the stories.

The Museum’s fun and fact-packed galleries explore the story of Roald Dahl’s life and encourage visitors to be creative.

Every family gets a free visitor guide to help everyone get the most from their visit.

Getting here

The address and phone number

81 to 83 High Street, Great Missenden, Buckinghamshire, HP16 0AL

01494 892192 (Text Relay 18001 01494 892192)

Great Missenden is a village in the heart of the Buckinghamshire countryside, situated about 27.5 miles east of Oxford (via the A418). Check our location on the map.

Opening hours

The museum is open:

Tuesday to Friday 10:oo am to 5:00 pm

Saturday and Sunday 11:00 am to 5:00 pm

It’s closed on most Mondays

All children under 16 years of age attending the Museum must be accompanied by an adult (i.e. an individual not younger than 18 years old) at all times.
